data.title: Very large triangle mesh collisionshape fails
data.body:
It took a while for us to figure it out, but if you load a very large model (say via AssetImporter to a single mdl file) with millions of polys, and then create a triangle mesh collisionshape using it - that will fail pretty hard.

The issue lies in the fact that Bullet's btBvhTriangleMeshShape evidently has a limit on how large mesh it can handle, we solved it by simply not enabling useQuantizedAabbCompression, using false on this line:
https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/blob/bb2ebf756838ae5512bbe624fd99161691da4695/Source/Urho3D/Physics/CollisionShape.cpp#L183

Not sure how to fix more properly, probably one would need to catch some kind of error or check size of mesh etc and only enable if mesh is small enough. Another "workaround" is to import big models as prefabs instead which means AssetImporter will break the model into MANY small models.

data.title: AngelScript binding for DetourCrowdManager::GetActiveAgents() issue
data.body:
When removing crowd agents, GetActiveAgents() is not accurately updated.

Steps to reproduce:
In sample 39_CrowdNavigation.as:
- MMB click on Jack to remove it
- agents.length is still 1, which causes some trouble as agent has been removed

Note: AngelScript specific issue (works perfectly in lua and C++)

data.title: Lua binding for DetourCrowdManager::GetActiveAgents()
data.body:
Please expose DetourCrowdManager::GetActiveAgents() to lua.
Using DetourCrowdManager to access the agents greatly simplifies life (I've already cleaned up sample 39_CrowdNavigation for C++ and AngelScript, waiting for lua).

data.title: Fixed compiler warning
data.body: As in #723

data.title: Error message when reloading a scene with obstacles
data.body:
When reloading a scene containing obstacles (like in sample 39_CrowdNavigation), dynamicNavigationMesh::RemoveObstacle() is triggered and an error is logged, as 'obstacleId_' is not available (not serialized).
I'm not sure how to properly handle this, as everything seems to work fine, but this error should not pop-up.

data.title: Segfault when removing a node with a CrowdAgent component
data.body:
Steps to reproduce:
In 39_CrowdNavigation.lua, add these lines to MoveCamera():

``` lua
    if input:GetKeyPress(KEY_O) then
        local tempNode = scene_:CreateChild("TempNode")
        tempNode:CreateComponent("CrowdAgent")
    end
    if input:GetKeyPress(KEY_P) then scene_:GetChild("TempNode", true):Remove() end

Also segfaults with C++ & AngelScript.
```

data.title: Updates to Navigation documentation
data.body: Updates to navigation documentation and request for comments on what everyone feels is important to cover versus what's overkill.

data.title: Compiler warnings: unused parameter
data.body:
When I compile with a high warning level (using GCC 4.9.2) I get many `unused parameter` compiler warnings. This is a bad thing (see references [1,2]). I suggest to either fix this, or let me fix this.

One (of many) example is in `Urho3D/include/Urho3D/Graphics/Direct3D9/D3D9Texture.h`:

```
void SetShadowCompare(bool enable) {}
```

I suggest to replace such a line to:

```
void SetShadowCompare(bool /* enable */) {}
```

Feel free to assign me this task.
## References

[1] Herb Sutter, Andrei Alexandrescu. C++ coding standards: 101 rules, guidelines, and best practices. 2005. ISBN: 0-32-111358-6. Item 1: 'Compile cleanly at high warning levels'.
[2] Linus Torvalds. Re:[PATCH] Don't compare unsigned variable for <0 in sys_prctl(). 2006-11-28. Retrieved on 2010-09-20. 'Friends don't let friends use [gcc] "-W"'

data.title: OpenGL3 float16 and float32 formats still to luminance
data.body: In OpenGL3 graphics subsystem, Graphics::GetFloat16Format() and Graphics::GetFloat32Format() functions still return deprecated GL_LUMINANCE format, should be GL_R16F and GL_R32F if gl3Support is on.

data.title: Texture not declared in Renderer.h
data.body:
I'm testing the latest branch, and I seem to have ran across a new issue. The samples compile fine, but my custom application using Urho3D static lib, built with -DURHO3D_OPENGL -DURHO3D_SAMPLES under VS2013. I've cross-checked my application's include paths and preprocessor arguments to be the exact same as the player application. However when building my application, I get the following errors:

```
1>C:\Users\<redacted>\Documents\GitHub\Idler\Dependencies\Urho3D\Build\include\Urho3D/Graphics/Renderer.h(302): error C2143: syntax error : missing ';' before '*'
1>C:\Users\<redacted>\Documents\GitHub\Idler\Dependencies\Urho3D\Build\include\Urho3D/Graphics/Renderer.h(302): error C4430: missing type specifier - int assumed. Note: C++ does not support default-int
1>C:\Users\<redacted>\Documents\GitHub\Idler\Dependencies\Urho3D\Build\include\Urho3D/Graphics/Renderer.h(302): warning C4183: 'GetScreenBuffer': missing return type; assumed to be a member function returning 'int'
1>C:\Users\<redacted>\Documents\GitHub\Idler\Dependencies\Urho3D\Build\include\Urho3D/Graphics/Renderer.h(397): error C2065: 'Texture' : undeclared identifier
1>C:\Users\<redacted>\Documents\GitHub\Idler\Dependencies\Urho3D\Build\include\Urho3D/Graphics/Renderer.h(397): error C2923: 'Urho3D::SharedPtr' : 'Texture' is not a valid template type argument for parameter 'T'
1>C:\Users\<redacted>\Documents\GitHub\Idler\Dependencies\Urho3D\Build\include\Urho3D/Graphics/Renderer.h(397): error C3203: 'SharedPtr' : unspecialized class template can't be used as a template argument for template parameter 'T', expected a real type
```

Including `<Urho3D/Graphics/Texture.h>` before `<Urho3D/Graphics/Renderer.h>` solves this. It seems to be caused by the fact that Texture2D is declared in the header, but Texture is not.

data.title: Better CrowdAgent state handling. Consistent use of AreaID instead of…
data.body:
… AreaType+AreaID.

CrowdAgent now tracks its previous state and sends the
CrowdAgentStateChanged event when appropriate. CrowdAgentStateChanged
event now includes both the target and agent states.

Additionally:
- GetAreaCost in NavigationMesh, script bindings updated
- Fixed error spawning Jack nodes on top of boxes in Angelscript sample

data.title: Monochrome PNG Has Artefacts
data.body: Black and white png's show up as red with pixelated artefacts.  Workaround is to use a regular, colored png.

data.title: No need to do versioning on binaries
data.body: As .a files are created from source, no need to do versioning on those files.

data.title: Implementation of DetourCrowd and DetourTileCache
data.body:
Added Components:
- DynamicNavigationMesh (uses DetourTileCache)
- Obstacle (interacts with DynamicNavigationMesh)
- DetourCrowdManager (uses DetourCrowd for crowd control)
- CrowdAgent (interacts with DetourCrowdManager)
- NavArea (marks area types)

Changes:
- Refactor NavigationMesh build process
- Addition of cylinder debug rendering
- Exposed Area Type Costs in navigation

CrowdNavigation sample for Lua, Angelscript, and C++ using
DynamicNavigationMesh, Obstacle, CrowdAgent, and DetourCrowdManager
components.

data.title: AutoExposure.hlsl shader is not compatibel with DirectX11 renderer
data.body: AutoExposure.hlsl shader is not compatible with DirectX11 renderer. It must have been missed in the renderer refractoring :)

data.title: WebP Textures
data.body:
How do we feel about supporting the loading of webp textures?

It seems possible to take just the decoding part of the reference implementation and hook it up to the existing image loading API, toss it in the third party source directory and hook up a "WANT_WEBP" flag in cmake.  I'll probably do this to my local copy regardless, but if we're okay merging this in to Urho I'll patch it in proper.

data.title: D3D11 Unlit & LitSolid shaders require UVs when not necessary
data.body: D3D11 refuses to create an input layout when vertex elements required by shader are missing. For example the notexture variation of the LitSolid shader still expects to read the UV coordinate, which results in models with no UVs failing to render. Add an additional shader define in these shaders to disable UV requirement.

data.title: Support MinGW 4.7 ABIs on Clang.
data.body: Fix for  #708.  Adds a secondary check for recent Clang versions in addition to mingw, so AngelScript won't cause explosions.

data.title: return value type mistake in "Variant.h" file, line 725
Building Assimp for Urho3D in Mac failing
data.body:
Building Urho3D in Mac using Xcode 6.2 fails to following error: "fatal error: 'AssimpPCH.h' file not found".
I understood there was some recent change to the way Assimp is bundled in the build and it seems to not work for Xcode 6.2 anymore. The actual cmake build works just fine, but when you try to build the xcode project you get the error above. This can be fixed by commenting the line "enable_pch (code/AssimPCH.h)" in CMakeLists.txt and rebuilding.

data.title: MinGW/Clang crash and premature deallocation using AngelScript in C++11 mode
data.body:
Environment:
MSYS
GCC 4.9.2
Clang 3.5.1
Windows 7

Situation:
Compiling under clang with C++11 enabled results in the AngelScript bindings being unusable.  After tracing around the debug and release builds under the same environment, it seems to be related with how strings are getting registered/allocated with AS.  Removing code that creates strings limps along a little further, so the errors seem to be focused around how strings/objects are being allocated.  At one point I also saw an error about an assertion volation where the refcount was off by one as well.

I'm not entirely sure what is causing this; it seems that calling functions works, as tracing through shows some methods do in fact work when the C++ and AS boundary is crossed.  It seems to be something related to constructors and reference counting, as though objects are being prematurely freed on their way out to AS  I did a third debug build under the native GCC and that particular build works, so it does appear to be compiler specific. Now the question is finding out exactly which part has to be dug around to fix _that_, since the rest of the codebase (including the samples written in C++) appears to work just fine in this setup.

data.title: Arbitrary vertex declarations
data.body:
Port the vertex declaration code from Turso3D, which allows defining vertex elements by semantic, index and format; for example you can define an arbitrary number of texcoords.

Retain compatibility with the old "element mask" system to still allow defining predefined semantic+index+format combos easily.

The binary model format will need a compatibility mechanism, for example specifying a zero element mask, which means that arbitrary vertex declarations follow.

After this is done, AssetImporter (and possibly OgreImporter) can be made to handle source data vertex declarations more accurately.

data.title: Improve Client and Server in same process
data.body:
As nearly almost all multiplayer game engines support a server in the same process as the client (a listen server), I tried doing this in Urho3D. I saw it was not possible to do this elegantly, without some ugly hacks. The most prevalent problems are:
- Unclear seperation between client and server, i solved this partially by making the client and server seperate dlls, loaded by an exe whose only purpose is to set up Urho and execute the client and server dlls. One can then use #defines to make shared code aware in which context (client or server) it is running.
- Engine Subsystems are shared between client and server. This is not wanted for some subsys, as the only exchange of information between the client and the server should be over the network. If, for example, I have a SceneManager storing all scenes of the client or server, I would not want the client to access a server scene. This is not possible in the current Urho3D engine without ugly hacks.

Therefore I propose this:
Add an optional parameter to RegisterSubsystem, RemoveSubsystem, GetSubsystem to specify whether it should be accessible by the client, server, or both/singleplayer (parameter absent). This allows registering a single class twice, so there is no interference and the class does not need to do the  checking itself. It also preserves backwards compatibility.

My question to you is if this is an optimal solution, and whether this would be accepted as a pull request.
If the feedback is positive, I will make the change and make a pull request as soon as I can.

data.title: Fix PCH build with Clang
data.body: Clang doesn't use include path (-I) when looking for PCH files.  Use full path to header instead.  Tested on Ninja and Make builds using GCC and Clang.

data.title: API for defining vertex / index buffers through VectorBuffer in script
data.body: Using VectorBuffer to write arbitrary data, then stuffing it to a vertex or index buffer should be workable in scripting, though not optimal. Implementing this should allow the DynamicGeometry example to be converted to script also.

data.title: Investigate getting rid of PrintUnicodeLine vs PrintLine
data.body: Ideally the user should not have to choose between correct piping to file, and correct Unicode printing to console. Check if both can be achieved, therefore eliminating the need for the separate PrintUnicode functions. This is only Windows-specific, on Unix fprintf is always used.

data.title: Add unsigned long and unsigned long long support to String += operator
Improve AssetImporter error print.
